bcl:subsection.bcl:text: If each of the requirements of subsection (2) is fulfilled in relation to a farm operation conducted as part of a farm business,

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: the farmer is not liable in nuisance to any person for any odour, noise, dust or other disturbance resulting from the farm operation, and
the farmer must not be prevented by injunction or other order of a court from conducting that farm operation.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: The requirements referred to in subsection (1) are that the farm operation must

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: be conducted in accordance with normal farm practices,
be conducted on, in or over land

bcl:subparagraph.bcl:text: that is in the agricultural land reserve,

bcl:text.#text: on which, under the , farm use is allowed,

bcl:subparagraph.bcl:text: that is used for a type of aquaculture prescribed for the purpose of paragraph (h) of the definition of "farm operation", or
that is Crown land designated as a farming area under subsection (2.1), and

bcl:text.#text: not be conducted in contravention of the , , , the regulations under those Acts or any land use regulation.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: The Lieutenant Governor in Council may designate Crown land as a farming area for the purposes of subsection (2) (b) (iv).

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: If a person is aggrieved by any odour, noise, dust or other disturbance resulting from a farm operation conducted as part of a farm business, the person may apply in writing to the board for a determination as to whether the odour, noise, dust or other disturbance results from a normal farm practice.

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: contain a statement of the nature of the complaint, the name and address of the person making the application, the name and address of the farmer and the location of the farm,
be in a form acceptable to the chair of board, and
be accompanied by the fee prescribed by the Lieutenant Governor in Council.

bcl:section.bcl:text: In the interest of reaching a settlement of a complaint that is the subject of an application under section 3 (1), the chair of the board, at any time before a panel of the board has decided the application, may inquire into matters relevant to the complaint, and, as part of that inquiry, may

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: obtain the advice of persons who are knowledgeable about normal farm practices, and
consult with the farmer identified in the application and the complainant.

bcl:section.bcl:text: After receipt of an application that meets the requirements of section 3, the chair of the board, if satisfied that any consultations under section 4 have been terminated without achieving a settlement of the complaint, or that settlement is unlikely, must establish a panel of the board to hear the complaint.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: The panel established to hear an application must hold a hearing and must

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: dismiss the complaint if the panel is of the opinion that the odour, noise, dust or other disturbance results from a normal farm practice, or

order the farmer to cease the practice that causes the odour, noise, dust or other disturbance if it is not a normal farm practice, or to modify the practice in the manner set out in the order, to be consistent with normal farm practice.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: The chair of the board, after giving the complainant an opportunity to be heard, may refuse to refer an application to a panel for the purpose of a hearing, or, after a hearing has begun, the panel to which an application has been referred may refuse to continue the hearing or to make a decision if, in the opinion of the chair of the board or the panel, as the case may be,

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: the subject matter of the application is trivial,
the application is frivolous or vexatious or is not made in good faith, or
the complainant does not have a sufficient personal interest in the subject matter of the application.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: Within 60 days after receiving written notice of a decision of the chair or a panel of the board made under section 6, the complainant or farmer affected by the decision may appeal the decision to the Supreme Court on a question of law or jurisdiction.
An appeal from a decision of the Supreme Court lies to the Court of Appeal with leave of a justice of the Court of Appeal.
The board, the chair of the board or a panel of the board may exercise the powers and perform the duties that are conferred or imposed on it under this Act.

bcl:text.#text: On the board's own initiative or at the request of a municipality or regional district, or of a trust council under the , the board may study, report on, and make recommendations concerning, any matter related to farm practices.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: The board must provide the minister with any information requested by the minister regarding the policies and procedures of the board.
The minister may order the board to study any matter related to farm practices and the board must conduct the study and report its findings and recommendations to the minister.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: Without limiting the generality of subsection (1), the Lieutenant Governor in Council may make regulations as follows:

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: respecting standards for the purpose of the definition of "normal farm practice";
governing practices and procedures for

bcl:subparagraph.bcl:text: hearings before a panel of the board, and
inquiries and consultations respecting complaints or other matters before the board, the chair of the board or a panel of the board;

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: respecting the engagement or retention of specialists and consultants by the board.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: The minister may make regulations prescribing one or more of the following:

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: specialty wood crops or specialty fibre crops for the purpose of paragraph (f) of the definition of "farm operation";
types of aquaculture for the purpose of paragraph (h) of the definition of "farm operation";
limits referred to in paragraph (k) of the definition of "farm operation";
exceptions for the purpose of paragraph (n) of the definition of "farm operation".
